ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so many things! I learned about how the universe works, what it's composed of, and how everything within it functions.

This course gave a good overview of general concepts in astronomy, but it focused mainly on the way the field of astronomy is structured, how science is done at different observatories, and how the field of astronomy might look in the future.
I learned about the fundamentals behind astrophysics research, how to make presentations, how to present, and how to report.
I learned a lot about space and telescopes and physics it was wild.

I got to understand more about astronomy as an industry and a career. I gained a better understanding of the processes behind starting, building, and launching telescopes and other astronomy projects. I studied the current state of astronomy including the new frontiers only now starting to be cracked (ie. Exoplanets, dark matter, dark energy, black holes, gravitational waves, etc.).

I learned alot about the science involved in both astronomy and physics. This course also gave me a basic understanding of how the discipline of astrophysics developed, as well as the history behind certain discoveries .

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is very interesting. I liked the in class discussions. It may help to have more consistent assignments throughout the year because I feel like before the final project, we really only had one other assignment (besides readings of course). Maybe more role-play games would be fun. I feel like the one that we did in the middle of the year really helped me improve my understanding of the subjects we were talking about at the time. I also loved the career panel we had. I found it super helpful to hear firsthand about going into different STEM fields as an undergrad.
This course was very fun and enjoyable, and Professor Charles was very much focused on our learning rather than having a rigid structure for the course. I have no complaints!
This course does well at providing a scientific seminar environment and engaging discussion.
Good work balance, until the final project
I like the projects but some of the lectures were a little tedious and hard to follow.

I would have liked to have more group conversations purely between the students. Head Charles was very helpful in giving insight into topics we were confused about, however, I would have liked to have more conversations where it was purely between classmates. I also think it would be interesting to dive more into the private sector.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student if you're interested in learning about astronomy and the current research going on right now. Professor Bailyn is very knowledgable and Yasmeen was great. The workload is not bad and the content is interesting. Sometimes class discussions can go off on a tangent.

Absolutely! If you want a good overview of astronomy (or if you are already knowledgeable and interested in the field), this class is a great way to get involved and learn more about the field than just the science behind it.
Yes because one learns how to write properly and present.
Yeah if youre interested in it the prof is super cool and there is a lot of interesting stuff you learn.

I definitely would recommend this course for anyone at all interested in astronomy. It covers the scientific aspects of modern astronomy while also looking at the politics and ethical dilemmas at the forefront of space exploration. This class covers almost every corner of modern astronomy.

I would recommend this course to another student because I learned so much about the field of astrophysics. I also walked away with a much greater appreciation for our universe, and the technologies we use to gather information about our universe.
